I don't believe Whitford. Webster was too big a coward to bring a suit when advised against it. The real mistake was in trusting law business to an ignorant, blethering gas-pipe like Whitford. I am not saying this in hatred, for I do not dislike Whitford. He is simply a damned fool — in Court — & will infallibly lose every suit you put into his hands. If you are going to have any [illeg.] lawsuits with Gill, I beg that you will either compromise or have some other law conduct the thing.
I am mighty sorry for you, but this result was to be expected. If I were you I would ask Whit- ford to present a modified bill — or better still, present it to the parties he won the case for.
Merry Xmas to you! — & I wish to g G od I could have one myself before I die.
